COM100.name: Human Communication
COM100.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM100.description: Process and functions of communication. Principles underlying communication behavior. Practice in analyzing communication situations and in speaking and writing.

COM225.name: An Introduction to Interpersonal Communication
COM225.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM225.description: Principles and practices of interpersonal communication. Emphasis on effective and responsible interpersonal communication.

COM240.name: Introduction to Organizational Communication
COM240.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM240.description: Theories, systems, structures and processes of organizational communication. Organizational cultures. Communication in multinational organizations and in individual, leadership, supervisor-subordinate and small group situations.

COM275.name: Effects of Mass Communication
COM275.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM275.description: Major social effects of mass media on audience behavior. Political communication. Media effects on children. Message strategies producing attitude change. Interrelationships between mass media and interpersonal communication.

COM300.name: Methods of Communication Inquiry
COM300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM300.description: Nature and conduct of communication inquiry. Significant questions about communication and finding systematic answers.

COM301.name: Special Topics in Communication Science, Analytics and Research Methods
COM301.description: Trending topics in communication science, analytics, and research methods.

COM310.name: Intercultural Communication
COM310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM310.description: How two or more people from different cultures or ethnic and racial groups use psychological, communicative, relational, nonverbal, contextual, and discourse strategies to conduct their relationships focusing on how miscommunication occurs and how people learn to be interculturally competent.
COM310.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or in the College of Education.

COM320.name: Diversity and Communication
COM320.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM320.description: Explore the interplay between communication processes and diverse identities such as race, ethnicity, class, sexual orientation, and gender.
COM320.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or sophomores in the College of Education or in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences.

COM325.name: Interpersonal Influence and Conflict
COM325.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM325.description: Theories, processes and models of interpersonal influence and conflict. Conflict resolution, compliance-gaining, resistance and persuasion.
COM325.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the College of Education or in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or in the Sales Leadership Minor.

COM330.name: Health Communication
COM330.description: Survey of health communication theory and research. Provides a substantive foundation of relevant theories, research, practices, and current issues related to health communication across interpersonal, group, organizational, and mediated communication.
COM330.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences.

COM340.name: Leadership and Group Communication
COM340.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM340.description: Theory and research on dyadic and group relations within organizations. Leadership, motivation, decision making, and teamwork.
COM340.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Communication Major or in the Sales Leadership Minor.

COM360.name: Advanced Sales Communication
COM360.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM360.description: Need-based selling and leadership role in meeting client needs. Advanced methods of questioning, customer need analysis, negotiation, effective presentations and interpersonal communication relationships with clients. Sales role-playing presentations, business and technical writing, portfolio presentations, and case studies.
COM360.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Sales Communication Specialization.

COM375.name: Audience Response to Media Entertainment
COM375.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM375.description: Theory and research on audience responses to media entertainment. Models of audience responses, reactions to violence in media, and children and the media.
COM375.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences.

COM399.name: Special Topics in Communication
COM399.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM399.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences.

COM401.name: Advanced Topics in Communication (W)
COM401.description: Exploring vital social, health, and political issues through communication research design.
COM401.prerequisite: (COM 300) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
COM401.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Communication.

COM402.name: Public Relations Topics in Communication
COM402.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM402.description: Current topics related to the practice of public relations.
COM402.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Public Relations Specialization. A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits in any or all enrollments in ADV 402, COM 402, JRN 402.

COM425.name: Communication in Close Relationships (W)
COM425.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM425.description: In-depth treatment of current research and of theoretical and methodological issues.
COM425.prerequisite: (COM 225 and COM 300) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
COM425.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Communication.

COM440.name: Organizational Communication Structure (W)
COM440.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM440.description: Systems approaches to information processing and communication structures in organizations.
COM440.prerequisite: (COM 300 and COM 240) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
COM440.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Communication.

COM475.name: Communication Campaign Design and Analysis (W)
COM475.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM475.description: Design and analysis of campaigns presented through mediated channels including electronic and print media.
COM475.prerequisite: (COM 275 and COM 300) or ((ADV 325 or ADV 425) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)
COM475.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Communication or in the Public Relations Minor.

COM483.name: Practicum in Sales Communication
COM483.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM483.description: Supervised practical experience in a professional sales environment
COM483.prerequisite: (COM 225 and MKT 313 and COM 360) and (MKT 300 or MKT 327)
COM483.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Sales Communication Specialization.

COM490.name: Independent Study
COM490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM490.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores. Approval of department; application required.

COM493.name: Internship
COM493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM493.description: Supervised practical experience in a professional environment.
COM493.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Communication Major. Approval of department; application required.

COM494.name: Practicum in Communication Research and Instruction
COM494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM494.description: Structured participation in departmental research teams and applied practice in the community.
COM494.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Department of Communication. Approval of department; application required.

COM801.name: Communication Research I
COM801.description: Communication research strategy and methodology. Scientific process. Derivation and test of hypotheses. Methods of research design.

COM802.name: Communication Research II
COM802.description: Further consideration of communication research strategy and methodology. Topics include systems theory, cybernetics, and transactional approach.

COM803.name: Introduction to Quantitative Research Methods
COM803.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
COM803.description: Introduction to quantitative social science research methods and applied analyses for understanding research reports and developing graduate level research projects.

COM815.name: Organizational Communication I
COM815.description: Emphasis on dyadic and group processes and organizational intervention strategies. Topics include managing diversity, organizational structure, and communication productivity.

COM816.name: Fundraising and Philanthropy in Nonprofit Organizations
COM816.description: Principles, function, practice, ethics, and process of fundraising and philanthropic development. Societal role of nonprofit organizations.
COM816.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences.

COM820.name: Communication Theory and Process
COM820.description: Role that theory plays in different areas of communication scholarship.

COM821.name: Mass Communication Theory and Research
COM821.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
COM821.description: Current mass communication research and theories, including exposure patterns, diffusion of news and social effects of mass media.

COM822.name: Theories of Interpersonal Communication
COM822.description: Examination of a broad range of theories and research in interpersonal communication. Development of a theoretical foundation and demonstration of the utility of interpersonal theories in a variety of contexts.

COM828.name: Cross-Cultural Communication
COM828.description: Problems in communicating across cultural boundaries, focusing on the processes, theories, and methods in the study of intercultural communication.

COM830.name: Applied Communication Research II
COM830.description: Thesis production. Reporting and evaluating the results of communication research.

COM855.name: Codes and Code Systems
COM855.description: Structure and function of verbal and nonverbal communication. Relationship between discourse and context. Generation of meaning through interaction.

COM860.name: Persuasion
COM860.description: Use of messages to gain compliance and effect social change. Persuasion and attitude change from classical theories to contemporary situations.

COM874.name: Communication in Supply Chain Management
COM874.description: Development of effective interpersonal communication skills. Oral communication in business settings, including presentation and interview skills. Use of appropriate technology for management presentations. Analysis of presentations in the work setting.
COM874.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Supply Chain Management major.

COM875.name: Communication Leadership Skills in Organizations
COM875.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
COM875.description: Theoretical and practical approaches to organizational communication and leadership. Communication and responsibility in a new era. Leadership self-assessment, leadership in action and managerial communication, and leadership accountability.
COM875.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major.

COM890.name: Independent Study
COM890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

COM893.name: Practicum
COM893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM893.description: Supervised experience in an applied-communication or health and risk communication setting.
COM893.prerequisite: COM 803 and COM 820 or approval of department; application required
COM893.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Communication or in the Health and Risk Communication major or in the Communication major. Approval of department; application required.

COM899.name: Master's Thesis Research
COM899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM899.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Communication.

COM901.name: Communication Research Design I
COM901.description: Methods of data collection and analysis. Writing and critiquing research reports.

COM902.name: Communication Research Design II
COM902.description: Further study of methods of data collection and analysis. Writing and critiquing research reports.

COM915.name: Organizational Communication II
COM915.description: Organizational communication structure and information processing. The organization's embeddedness in a larger social environment.

COM921.name: Micro and Macro Media
COM921.description: Perspectives on media processes pertaining to individuals, groups, and large-scale systems. Topics include cognitive processing of media, public opinion and affective responses to media.

COM922.name: Interpersonal Communication
COM922.description: Theory and research in interpersonal communication. Role of communication in processes such as interpersonal influence and relationship development.

COM990.name: Independent Study
COM990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM990.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Communication. Approval of department.

COM999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
COM999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
COM999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or in the Department of Communication or in the Communication Major.
